title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1124/92 of 30 April 1992 on the issuing of import licences for certain processed mushroom products originating in third countries and repealing Regulation (EEC) No 17/92
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 1124/92  of 30 April 1992  on the issuing of import licences for certain processed mushroom products originating in third countries and repealing Regulation (EEC) No 17/92
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN  COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Applications for import licences under Article 5 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 1707/90 shall be authorized once more from 4 May 1992.
Licences should be issued in respect of a maximum of 6 072 tonnes net drained weight.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 30 April 1992. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 183, 4. 7. 1981, p. 1. (2) See page 98 of this Official Journal. (3) OJ No L 3, 8. 1. 1992, p. 5. (4) OJ No L 158, 23. 6. 1990, p. 34. (5) See page 100 of this Official Journal. (6) OJ No L 350, 19. 12. 1991, p. 40. (7) OJ No L 51,  26. 2. 1992, p. 6.
